$schema.description: Reference to the JSON Schema for validation and editor support.

root.description: The URL of the root repository. This is the main hosting location that acts as the source of truth for the codebase.

gitmail.description: An email address associated with the repository for submitting git patches.

icon.description: A public URL or data URI formatted image (PNG, SVG, etc.) representing an icon for the repository.

description.description: A brief description of the repository's purpose or contents.

tags.description: A list of tags or keywords associated with the repository for easier categorization and searchability.

mirrors.description: A list of URLs representing mirror repositories.

maintainers.description: A list of maintainers or contributors to the repository, provided as a 2D array with names and email addresses in the format [[name, email], ...].

license.description: The license under which the repository is distributed. Use the short identifier from SPDX License List for consistency.

homepage.description: The URL of the project's homepage or documentation site, if separate from the repository.

funding.description: A list of URLs for sponsorship or funding platforms (e.g., GitHub Sponsors, Open Collective, Patreon).

version.description: The version of the .gitinfo schema being used. Can be a semver string or a git commit hash.

ci.description: The URL of the CI/CD platform or pipeline status page for the repository.

issues.description: The URL of the issue tracker, if different from the root repository.

chat.description: The URL of a community chat platform (e.g., Discord, Matrix, Slack, IRC).

docs.description: The URL of the project's documentation site.
